revised_title: Experiments and Observations on Bulbous Roots and Their Growth in Water
tldr: The author explores the growth and blooming of bulbous roots, such as hyacinths, narcissus, tulips, and junquils, in water-filled containers. He discovers that these plants can thrive and even improve in quality when grown underwater, and that they can be manipulated to bloom year-round by adjusting the warmth of their environment.
